sources.title: "For Better, for Worse" (1919) director Cecil B.DeMille starring Gloria Swanson
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation     "For Better, for Worse" is an absorbing drama of war, tragedy and love triangles. The events in the film occur around World War I. The film was created by the renowned director Cecil B. DeMille.   Directed by               Cecil B. DeMille Produced by             Famous Players-Lasky Corporation Scenario                      Jeanie Macpherson Based on                    the play For Better, For Worse by Edgar Selwyn Starring                     Gloria Swanson, Elliott Dexter, Tom Forman, Wanda Hawley, Mae Giraci, Raymond Hatton Cinematography        Alvin Wyckoff Distributed by           Famous Players-Lasky Corporation Release date               April 27, 1919 Running time             90 min. metadata.Plot: Dr. Edward Meade and friend Richard Burton both love Sylvia Norcross. Both enlist in the military, but Meade stays back to care for deformed children. Sylvia thinks him a coward and marries Burton. After Burton is presumed dead, Meade and Sylvia are to wed, but Burton returns maimed and scarred.
metadata.Writer: Jeanie Macpherson, Edgar Selwyn, William C. de Mille
